response.answer_text: Here’s an updated answer to this question. We are currently at FL Studio version number 20 (since 2018). Version 12 was released way back in 2015. How can you get FL Studio for free? The short answer is you cannot. It’s not free and never has been. What you can get however is a ‘free trial’. You can use it for an unlimited time which may create confusion, however features are limited. So it’s meant for testing purposes only. You cannot open FL Studio projects, only save them.Functions such as “clone channel”, “save preset as…” which use the save/load capability won’t work.You can only export to WAV or MP3.The free trial does however allow you to test all the features and the plugins that they’ve created. The full version of the software comes with these licenses; FL Studio Fruity Edition $99.00FL Studio Producer Edition 199.00FL Studio Signature Bundle $299.00FL Studio + ALL Plugins Bundle $899.00All purchases include lifetime free updates. Also if you are a student you may qualify for an academic discount and purchase the ‘academic/student version’ of FL Studio from a reseller. You’ll find detailed information and relevant download links, etc. from the official developers ‘Image-Line Software’ website. Thanks for asking!

No, it’s not free, but it comes in various flavours, a student edition, a suite edition and others. Basically the student edition won’t give you all the awesome plugins but you can still commence arranging your music and making melodies. If you don’t want to buy it, you can pirate it, but that means you won’t get all the automatic updates and stuff. Or you could start off with a free DAW like Ardour and then buy FL Studio after attaining some prowess in your production and making some money off of it.
